author: Digital Foundry
description:
After the success of the brilliant Tony Hawk's Pro-Skater 1+2, Activision enlisted the assistance of Iron Galaxy to deliver Pro Skater 3+4, and while there are some controversial changes, we think it's an excellent game - well worth checking out. But what of the originals? John travels back to the early noughties to look at the OG releases, their ports and their companion games in the Activision O2 line-up of sports titles. 

00:00 - Introduction
02:55 - The Impact of Tony Hawk
04:28 - Introducing Pro Skater 3 at E3 2001
05:21 - This Game Still Rules
06:14 - Upgrades from PS1
08:08 - Activision O2
10:52 - THPS3 Console Ports
15:39 - Yes, THPS3 was on PS1 and N64
21:03 - THPS3 Returns in 2025!
26:14 - 2002 and the Road of Pro Skater 4
28:30 - Wait, Pro BMX 2 is also an FPS?!
29:37 - Pro Skater 4 Arrives!
33:29 - Original Xbox at 720p! HD in 2002!
35:47 - THPS4 also released on PS1!
37:33 - Big Changes to THPS4 in 2025
42:20 - The End of Activision O2
46:16 - Credits
title: DF Retro: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 - The Original Games, The Ports, The Modern Version, The Legacy
